'''Donald McKinley Glover Jr.''' (born September 25, 1983) is an American actor, comedian, writer, director, rapper, and DJ. He performs music under the stage name '''Childish Gambino''' and as a DJ under the name '''mcDJ'''.<ref name="Childish Gambino releases surprise song This is America">{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/newsbeat-44017879 |title=Childish Gambino releases surprise song This is America |date=6 May 2018 |access-date=11 May 2018}} "The artist has said his next album will be his last under his musical stage name."</ref>
He first came to public attention for his work with [[Derrick Comedy]] while a student at [[New York University]], and [[Tina Fey]] hired him at age 23 as a writer for the [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[30 Rock]]''. He later portrayed community college student [[Troy Barnes]] on the NBC sitcom ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]''. He stars in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] series ''[[Atlanta (TV series)|Atlanta]]'', which he created and occasionally directs.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2016/09/06/with-atlanta-donald-glover-wants-to-make-people-feel-black.html |title=Donald Glover stars in a new TV show about rappers in the Atlana scene |last= |first= |date=September 6, 2016 |website=DailyBeast |access-date=September 7, 2016}}</ref> For his work on ''Atlanta'', Glover won various accolades, including [[Primetime Emmy Award]]s for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series]] and [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series|Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.emmys.com/bios/donald-glover|title=Donald Glover {{!}} Television Academy|work=Television Academy|access-date=September 19, 2017|language=en}}</ref> and [[Golden Globe Award]]s for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Television Series - Musical or Comedy|Best Television Series – Musical or Comedy]] and [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Best Actor – Television Series Musical or Comedy]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2017/01/08/donald-glover-30-under-30-alum-wins-big-for-atlanta-at-the-global-globes/#4bceb3587b6c|title=Donald Glover Wins Big For 'Atlanta' At The Golden Globes|last=Berg|first=Madeline|work=Forbes|access-date=September 19, 2017|language=en}}</ref> In film, Glover has appeared in ''[[Mystery Team]]'' (2009), ''[[The Lazarus Effect (2015 film)|The Lazarus Effect]]'', ''[[Magic Mike XXL]]'', ''[[The Martian (film)|The Martian]]'' (all 2015), ''[[Spider-Man: Homecoming]]'' (2017) as [[Prowler (comics)#Ultimate Marvel|Aaron Davis]], and as the young [[Lando Calrissian]] in ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]'' (2018).<ref>{{cite web|title=Donald Glover|url=http://www.starwars.com/news/donald-glover-cast-as-young-lando-calrissian-in-upcoming-han-solo-star-wars-stand-alone-film|work=[[Star Wars]]}}</ref> He will also provide the voice of [[Simba]] in a remake of the Disney film ''[[The Lion King (2019 film)|The Lion King]]'' (2019).
After several self-released albums and mixtapes, Glover signed to [[Glassnote Records]] in 2011. He released his first album, ''[[Camp (album)|Camp]]'', on November 15, 2011, to generally positive reviews. His second studio album, ''[[Because the Internet]]'', was released on December 10, 2013.<ref name="Billboard">{{cite news| last1=Lynch|first1=Joe|title=Grammys 2015: And the Nominees Are…|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/6363565/grammys-2015-nominations-57th-annual|accessdate=December 25, 2014|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]| date= December 5, 2014}}</ref> Glover's third album, ''[["Awaken, My Love!"]]'', was released on December 2, 2016, spawning the single "[[Redbone (song)|Redbone]]", which peaked at number 12 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]],<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/299122/childish-gambino/chart|title=Childish Gambino - Chart history {{!}} Billboard|website=www.billboard.com|language=en|access-date=September 19, 2017}}</ref> and eventually earned him a [[Grammy Award for Best Traditional R&B Performance]]. In 2017, Glover was included on the annual [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] list of the most influential people in the world.<ref name="time100">{{cite news|last1=Fey|first1=Tina|title=Donald Glover: The World's 100 Most Influential People|url=http://www.time.com/collection/2017-time-100/4736210/donald-glover/|accessdate=April 8, 2018|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=April 20, 2017|language=en-us}}</ref> In 2018, Glover released the song and video for "[[This Is America (song)|This Is America]]", which [[List of Billboard Hot 100 chart achievements and milestones#Number-one debuts|debuted at number-one on the Hot 100]].
==Early life== Donald McKinley Glover Jr.<ref name=AXS>{{cite web |url=https://www.axs.com/5-things-you-didn-t-know-about-donald-glover-58110|title=5 things you didn't know about Donald Glover|last=Jules|first=Anny|publisher=AXS|date=June 16, 2015|accessdate=May 12, 2018}}</ref> was born on September 25, 1983 at [[Edwards Air Force Base]] in [[Kern County, California]].<ref name=BandS>{{cite web| url= http://www.bluesandsoul.com/feature/787/childish_gambino_growing_gains/| number= 1074 |title= Childish Gambino: Growing Gains| website= BluesandSoul.com | first= Pete| last= Lewis | accessdate= January 16, 2016}}</ref> He was raised in [[Stone Mountain, Georgia]]. His mother, Beverly (''née'' Smith),<ref name=FamilySearch>{{cite web| url= https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:VGLJ-ZLX| website= FamilySearch.org| publisher= citing California Birth Index, 1905-1995 database; Department of Health Services, Vital Statistics Department, Sacramento|title= Person details for Donald Mckinley Glover| accessdate= January 16, 2016}}</ref> is a retired [[Day care|daycare]] provider, and his father, Donald Glover Sr.,<ref name="AS">{{cite web|url=https://www.axs.com/5-things-you-didn-t-know-about-donald-glover-58110|title=5 things you didn’t know about Donald Glover|publisher=AXS|date=16 June 2015|author=Jules, Anna}}</ref> is a retired postal worker.<ref name="villagevoice">{{cite web|title=Donald Glover Is More Talented Than You, The comedian/writer/rapper is on a collision course with stardom|first=Bill|last=Jensen|date=April 13, 2011|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2011-04-13/news/donald-glover-is-more-talented-than-you/2/|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006103634/http://www.villagevoice.com/2011-04-13/news/donald-glover-is-more-talented-than-you/2/|archivedate=October 6, 2014|df=mdy-all}}</ref> His parents also served as foster parents for 14 years. Glover was raised as a [[Jehovah's Witnesses|Jehovah's Witness]].<ref name= BandS /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2015/02/20/donald-glover-on-spider-man-stripping-in-magic-mike-xxl-and-a-possible-community-return.html|title=Donald Glover on Spider-Man, Stripping in 'Magic Mike XXL,' and A Possible 'Community' Return|work=The Daily Beast}}</ref> He attended [[DeKalb School of the Arts]] and was captioned "Most Likely to Write for ''[[The Simpsons]]''" in his high school yearbook.<ref name="clatl20160829">{{cite web | url=http://www.clatl.com/culture/article/20831904/donald-glovers-real-rap-on-atlanta | title=Donald Glover's real rap on 'Atlanta' | publisher=Creative Loafing | date=August 29, 2016 | accessdate=August 29, 2016 | author=Carmichael, Rodney}}</ref><ref name="Rolling Stone">{{cite web |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/pictures/comedys-new-wave-20110907/donald-glover-the-triple-threat-0225803 |last1=Eells|first1=Josh|title=Donald Glover: The Triple Threat|website=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=September 7, 2011|accessdate=July 14, 2017}}</ref>
Glover graduated from the New York University [[Tisch School of the Arts]] with a degree in Dramatic Writing (2006).<ref>{{cite web|title=Donald Glover|url=http://www.nbc.com/community/about/bio/donald-glover|work=[[NBC]]}}</ref> While at Tisch, Glover self-produced the independent mixtape ''The Younger I Get'', which was not released and was disowned by Glover for being "too-raw ramblings" of what he calls a "decrepit [[Drake (musician)|Drake]]".<ref name="MenchComplex" /> Glover also began [[disc jockey]]ing and producing [[electronic music]] under the moniker MC D—later as mcDJ—remixing [[Sufjan Stevens]]' album ''[[Illinois (Sufjan Stevens album)|Illinois]]'' (2005).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Wilcox|first1=Dan|title=Donald Glover|url=https://www.kcrw.com/music/shows/guest-dj-project/donald-glover|publisher=[[KCRW]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=May 11, 2011}}</ref>
==Career==
===2006–2010: Derrick Comedy, ''Community'', and mixtapes=== In 2006, Glover was contacted by producer [[David Miner (television producer)|David Miner]], to whom he sent writing samples including a [[spec script]] that he had written for ''[[The Simpsons]]''. Miner and [[Tina Fey]] were impressed by Glover's work and invited him to become a writer for the NBC sitcom ''[[30 Rock]]''.<ref name="villagevoice"/><ref name="Rolling Stone" /> Glover was a writer for ''30 Rock'' from 2006 to 2009, where he also had occasional [[cameo appearance|cameo]] appearances. He was presented the [[Writers Guild of America Awards|Writers Guild of America Award]] for Best Comedy Series at the [[Writers Guild of America Awards 2008|February 2009 ceremony]] for his work on the third season.<ref name="WGA 09 Official">{{cite press release|url=http://wga.org/content/default.aspx?id=3410 |title=2009 Writers Guild Awards Television, Radio, News, Promotional Writing, and Graphic Animation Nominees Announced |accessdate=January 19, 2012 |publisher=[[Writers Guild of America]] |date=December 8, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081212052838/http://www.wga.org/content/default.aspx?id=3410 |archivedate=December 12, 2008 |df=mdy }}</ref> Glover's musical stage name, Childish Gambino, came from the [[Wu-Tang Clan]]'s name generator.<ref>{{cite web| last1= Rowles| first1= Dustin|title=Strange Mystery Behind Donald Glover's Rap Name, Childish Gambino| url=http://uproxx.com/tv/2014/12/the-mindblowing-mystery-behind-donald-glovers-rap-name-childish-gambino/|website=Uproxx|date=December 23, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Watch Childish Gambino Spit with The Roots on "Jimmy Fallon"|url=http://popdust.com/2011/04/07/childish-gambino-donald-glover-jimmy-fallon/|website=PopDust|date=April 7, 2011}}</ref> In June 2008, he released the independent [[mixtape]] ''Sick Boi''.<ref name="MenchComplex">{{cite web|last1=Mench|first1=Chris|title=But I'm Not a Rapper: Everything You Need to Know About Childish Gambino's First Three Mixtapes|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2015/08/everything-you-need-to-know-about-childish-gambinos-first-three-mixtapes|website=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|accessdate=February 1, 2018|date=August 26, 2015}}</ref> In 2008, Glover unsuccessfully auditioned to play [[President of the United States|President]] [[Barack Obama]] on the sketch comedy program ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'';<ref>{{cite web|last1=Sklar|first1=Rachel|title=Whobama? SNL Returns Tonight With Mystery Obama, And Actual Huckabee|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/whobama-snl-returns-tonig_n_87926|website=[[HuffPost]]|accessdate=April 4, 2018|date=March 28, 2008}}</ref> the role went to cast member [[Fred Armisen]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Egner|first1=Jeremy|title=A Tale of Two Obamas|url=https://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/03/12/a-tale-of-two-obamas/|website=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=April 4, 2018|date=March 12, 2010}}</ref> Glover also became a member of the [[sketch comedy]] group Derrick Comedy, having appeared in their sketches on [[YouTube]] since 2006, along with [[Dominic Dierkes]], Meggie McFadden, [[DC Pierson]], and [[Dan Eckman]]. The group wrote and starred in a feature-length film, ''[[Mystery Team]]'', released in theaters in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Angelo|first1=Megan|title=His Day Job Subsidizes All That Other Stuff|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/14/arts/television/14glover.html|website=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=February 1, 2018|date=March 10, 2018}}</ref>
[[File:DonaldGloverMar10.jpg|thumb|170px|Donald Glover at a panel for ''Community'' at [[PaleyFest]] 2010]] Glover became known to a wider audience with [[Dan Harmon]]'s [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'', which premiered in September 2009. Glover played Troy Barnes, a former high school star quarterback who quickly abandons his former jock mentality and embraces his nerdy, childish side as the result of his friendship with Abed Nadir (played by [[Danny Pudi]]).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Greenberg|first1=Rudi|title=One of a Kind: 'Community' Star Donald Glover and His Rap Alter-Ego Childish Gambino at the Black Cat|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/express/wp/2011/05/05/donald-glover-childish-gambino-community-black-cat/|website=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=February 1, 2018|date=May 4, 2011}}</ref> Glover did not return as a full-time cast member for the show's fifth season, appearing in the first five of the season's 13 episodes.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ausiello|first1=Michael|title=''Community'' Season 5: Donald Glover Not Returning Full Time -- Who's Gonna Tell Abed?|url=http://tvline.com/2013/07/08/community-season-5-donald-glover-leaving/|website=[[TVLine]]|accessdate=February 1, 2018|date=July 8, 2013}}</ref> Despite speculation that he was leaving to pursue his rap career as Childish Gambino, a series of hand-written notes that Glover posted to [[Instagram]] revealed that his reasons were more personal, citing a need for projects that offered him more independence as he worked through some personal issues.<ref>{{cite web| last1= Bojalad| first1= Alec|title=Donald Glover explains why he left 'Community' in letter to fans| url=http://www.hypable.com/donald-glover-explains-left-community-letter/|website=Hypable|date=October 15, 2013}}</ref> Although Harmon approached Glover about returning to the show for its sixth season, Glover declined, stating both show and audience would be better served by the closure of his character omitted from the story.<ref>{{cite web| last1= Alexander| first1= Julia|title=Donald Glover on why he had to leave Community to move his career forward| url=http://www.polygon.com/tv/2016/8/9/12415520/donald-glover-community-atlanta-childish-gambino/|website=Polygon|date=August 9, 2016}}</ref> In September 2009, he released his second mixtape ''Poindexter''.<ref name="MenchComplex" /> A pair of mixtapes, titled ''I Am Just a Rapper'' and ''I Am Just A Rapper 2'', were released in close succession in 2010 and followed that July by his fifth mixtape ''[[Culdesac (album)|Culdesac]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Vitcavage|first1=Adam|title=15 Essential Pre-Camp Childish Gambino Songs|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/blogs/lists/2011/11/15-essential-pre-camp-childish-gambino-songs.html|website=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]|accessdate=February 1, 2018|date=November 16, 2011}}</ref>
In March 2010, Glover performed a 30-minute set on the stand-up showcase program ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]''.<ref name="BusinessInsider">{{cite web|last1=Lynch|first1=John|title=How Donald Glover went from unknown comedy writer to triple-threat Hollywood star|url=http://nordic.businessinsider.com/donald-glover-career-bio-2016-9/|website=[[Business Insider]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=September 7, 2016}}</ref> In May 2010, a fan suggested Glover for the role of [[Peter Parker]] in the then-upcoming ''[[The Amazing Spider-Man (2012 film)|The Amazing Spider-Man]]'' film, encouraging his supporters to retweet the hashtag "#donald4spiderman".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Yamato|first1=Jen|title=How Donald Glover wound up in 'Spider-Man: Homecoming,' and what it might mean for an inclusive future|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-spider-man-homecoming-donald-glover-20170706-story.html|website=[[The Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=July 6, 2017}}</ref> The campaign, originally started to see how far social networking could carry a message, quickly gained a large following.<ref>{{cite web |title= Donald Glover Campaigns for Spider-Man Audition |url=http://www.slashfilm.com/donald-for-spider-man/ |first=Peter |last=Sciretta| publisher=[[/Film]] |date=May 30, 2010 |accessdate=January 19, 2012}}</ref> The call for Glover to be allowed to audition for the role was supported by [[Spider-Man]] creator [[Stan Lee]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://io9.com/5559655/smilin-stan-lee-weighs-in-on-donald-glover-for-spider+man |title=Smilin' Stan Lee weighs in on Donald Glover for Spider-Man |publisher=[[io9]] |first=Cyriaque |last=Lamar |date=June 9, 2010 |accessdate=December 26, 2010}}</ref> Glover was not given an audition and the role instead went to [[Andrew Garfield]]. He later revealed that he was never contacted for the role by anyone from [[Sony Pictures]]. Comics writer [[Brian Michael Bendis]], who announced [[Spider-Man (Miles Morales)|Miles Morales]], an African-American version of Spider-Man, a year later, said he had conceived of the character before Glover's campaign went viral.<ref name="huff">{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/08/02/new-ultimate-spider-man-half-black-half-latino_n_916468.html |title=New Ultimate Spider-Man Is Half-Black, Half-Latino |first=Matt |last=Moore |date=August 2, 2011 |accessdate=August 5, 2011 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=Huffington Post}}</ref> Bendis gave credit to Glover for influencing the new hero's looks for Spider-Man; Bendis has said, "I saw him in the costume [on ''Community''] and thought, 'I would like to read that book.{{'"}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/comics/2011-08-02-new-spider-man-inside_n.htm |title=A TV comedy assured new Spidey's creator |first=Brian |last=Truitt |work=[[USA Today]] |date=August 2, 2011 |accessdate=January 22, 2012}}</ref> Glover later voiced this incarnation of Spider-Man on the ''[[Ultimate Spider-Man (TV series)|Ultimate Spider-Man]]'' animated series.<ref>{{cite web| last= Truitt| first=Brian|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2014/08/26/donald-glover-ultimate-spider-man-exclusive/14559815/|title=Spider-Man 'can be anybody' – and now he's Donald Glover|work= [[USA Today]]|date=August 26, 2014|accessdate=August 26, 2014}}</ref> Glover received the Rising Comedy Star award at the [[Just for Laughs]] festival in July 2010 and was featured in [[Gap (clothing retailer)|Gap]]'s 2010 holiday advertising campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/aziz-ansari-and-donald-glover-to-be-honored-in-montreal_article_33847 |title=Aziz Ansari & Donald Glover To Be Honored in Montreal |publisher=[[Access Hollywood]] |date=June 24, 2010 |accessdate=December 26, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Bowers|first1=Brandon|title='Net-savvy Merced native featured in Gap ad campaign|url=http://www.mercedsunstar.com/latest-news/article3256961.html|website=[[Merced Sun-Star]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=December 4, 2010}}</ref>
===2011–2014: ''Camp'' and ''Because the Internet''=== [[File:Childish Gambino-Bowery Ballroom-1.jpg|thumb|left|Glover performing as Childish Gambino at the [[Bowery Ballroom]] in [[New York City]] in 2010]]
His first [[extended play]], titled ''[[EP (Childish Gambino EP)|EP]]'', was released as a free digital download in March 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1659468/donald-glover-untitled-ep.jhtml |title=Donald Glover Releases Untitled EP |author=Roberts, Steven |work=[[MTV]].com |date=March 8, 2011 |accessdate=April 10, 2011}}</ref> A music video for the song "Freaks and Geeks" was released in that month and Glover hosted the [[mtvU]] Wooodie Awards, held live at [[South By Southwest]].<ref name="Billboard2011"/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Ng|first1=Philiana|title=Donald Glover to Host mtvU Woodie Awards|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-glover-host-mtvu-woodie-163381|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=March 2, 2011}}</ref> Glover commenced his nationwide IAMDONALD Tour in April.<ref name="Billboard2011">{{cite web|last1=Mapes|first1=Jillian|title='Community' Actor Donald Glover Shows Off Rap Skills on 'Freaks and Geeks|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/viral-videos/472835/community-actor-donald-glover-shows-off-rap-skills-on-freaks|website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=February 5, 2018|date=March 28, 2011}}</ref> The tour was a one-man live show that consisted of rap, comedy, and video segments.<ref name="Billboard2011" /><ref name=vv>{{cite web |last=Jensen |first=Bill |title=Donald Glover Is More Talented Than You |url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2011-04-13/news/donald-glover-is-more-talented-than-you/ |work=[[The Village Voice]] |date=April 13, 2011 |accessdate=May 12, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110429213210/http://www.villagevoice.com/2011-04-13/news/donald-glover-is-more-talented-than-you/ |archivedate=April 29, 2011 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Glover appeared at the [[2011 Bonnaroo Music Festival]] as both Childish Gambino and as a comedian, performing a set with [[Bill Bailey]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Shuldman|first1=Harry|title=The A.V. Club at Bonnaroo 2011|url=https://music.avclub.com/the-a-v-club-at-bonnaroo-2011-1798226106|website=[[The A.V. Club]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=June 15, 2011}}</ref> His one-hour stand-up special, ''Weirdo'', aired on [[Comedy Central]] in November 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/television/Community-Donald-Glover-Schedules-Stand-Up-Special-Weirdo-Comedy-Central-34351.html |title=Community's Donald Glover Schedules Stand-Up Special ''Weirdo'' For Comedy Central |website=Cinema Blend |first=Jesse |last=Carp |date=August 17, 2011 |accessdate=January 22, 2012}}</ref> Glover worked with friend and film composer [[Ludwig Göransson]] on his debut studio album throughout 2011.<ref>Weté, Brad. "I Ain't No Joke." ''Billboard'' 123.42 (2011): n. pag. ''ProQuest''. Web. October 5, 2015.</ref> Prior to its release, signed to [[Glassnote Records]] and embarked on The Sign-Up Tour.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Baltin|first1=Stev|title=Donald Glover's Hip-Hop Act Childish Gambino Signs to Glassnote|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/donald-glovers-hip-hop-act-childish-gambino-signs-to-glassnote-20110906|website=[[Rolling Stone]]|accessdate=January 5, 2018|date=September 6, 2011}}</ref> The album, ''[[Camp (album)|Camp]]'', was released on November 15, 2011, backed by his debut single "Bonfire" and "[[Heartbeat (Childish Gambino song)|Heartbeat]]", which peaked at number 18 on the [[Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles]] and number 54 on [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]].<ref name="BillboardChartHistory">{{cite web|title=Childish Gambino Chart History|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/childish-gambino/chart-history|website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=February 5, 2018}}</ref> ''Camp'' debuted at number eleven on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 52,000 copies in the first week,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.17721/title.hip-hop-album-sales-the-week-ending-11-20-2011|title=Hip Hop Album Sales: The Week Ending 11/20/2011|work=[[HipHopDX]]|date=November 23, 2011|accessdate=May 22, 2016|author=ajacobs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150123171140/http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.17721/title.hip-hop-album-sales-the-week-ending-11-20-2011|archivedate=January 23, 2015|df=}}</ref> and was generally well received by critics,<ref>{{cite web|title=Camp by Childish Gambino Reviews and ==Influences== In an interview with ''[[The Guardian]]'' Glover stated, "I'm influenced by [[LCD Soundsystem]] as much as [[Ghostface Killah]]. A lot of the rap shows I saw as a kid were boring, but if you went to a [[Rage Against the Machine]] show or a [[Justice (band)|Justice]] show, the kids were losing their minds. Kids just want to go nuts, [[Odd Future]] know that. People want to experience something physical."<ref>{{Cite news|author=Fitzpatrick, Rob|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2011/dec/08/donald-glover-childish-gambino-camp|title=how Childish Gambino faces down rap stereotypes|date=December 8, 2011|accessdate=May 13, 2017}}</ref> Glover also cites hip hop duo [[Outkast]] and trio [[Migos]],<ref>{{cite web|last1=Duboff|first1=Josh|title=The Best Stuff on Earth, According to Donald Glover: Sarah Paulson, "Bootylicious," and More|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/10/donald-glover-favorite-things|website=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|accessdate=February 17, 2018|date=November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Levine|first1=Nick|title=Watch Donald Glover thank Migos for ‘Bad And Boujee’ as he accepts Golden Globe|url=http://www.nme.com/news/music/watch-donald-glover-thank-migos-bad-boujee-accepts-golden-globe-1940254|website=[[NME]]|accessdate=February 17, 2018|date=January 9, 2017}}</ref> and funk band [[Funkadelic]] as being influences.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Weiner|first1=Jonah|title=Hot Off 'Atlanta,' Donald Glover Prepares for 'Star Wars' & Childish Gambino's Funkadelic-Inspired Return|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/magazine-feature/7580497/donald-glover-childish-gambino-atlanta-star-wars|website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=February 17, 2018|date=November 17, 2016}}</ref>
Glover has also influenced a number of younger musicians and actors alike. Rapper [[Vince Staples]] talks of Glover's ability to constantly reinvent himself while actor and writer [[Naren Weiss]] cites his versatility as a source of inspiration.<ref>{{cite news|author1=Coscarelli, Joe|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/06/29/arts/music/vince-staples-interview-big-fish-theory.html|title=Vince Staples Prefers to Speak Only for Himself|date=July 7, 2017|accessdate=July 14, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author1=Bhateja, Apeksha|url=http://travelandleisureindia.in/naren-weiss/|title=Here+Now|date=July 7, 2017|accessdate=July 14, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Carter, Brooke|url=https://gazettereview.com/2017/11/donald-glover-height-weight-age-wife/|title=Donald Glover biography|date=November 24, 2017 |accessdate=March 5, 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Glover has a younger brother, writer/producer [[Stephen Glover (screenwriter)|Stephen]], who was also nominated for an Emmy for Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series for ''Atlanta''.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rose|first1=Lacey|title=How Donald Glover's Brother Went From Chemical Engineering to 'Atlanta's' Lead Writer|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/how-donald-glovers-brother-went-chemical-engineering-atlantas-lead-writer-1027637|accessdate=April 8, 2018|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=August 9, 2017|language=en}}</ref>
In January 2017, Glover announced that he and his partner, Michelle, had a son in early 2016.<ref>Ng, Philiana, [http://www.etonline.com/awards/goldenglobes/206880_donald_glover_reveals_sex_of_his_baby_golden_globes_speech/ "'Atlanta' Star Donald Glover Reveals Sex of His Baby in Golden Globes Speech, Praises His Girlfriend"], ''ET'', January 8, 2017.</ref><ref>Ungerman, Alex, [http://www.etonline.com/news/200152_donald_glover_is_a_father/ "Donald Glover Is a Father, Had His First Child Earlier This Year"], ''ET'', October 11, 2016.</ref> In June, before performing "Baby Boy" in a tribute to his son, he revealed his name as Legend.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2017/06/donald-glover-hints-at-final-childish-gambino-album-during-governors-ball-set|title=Donald Glover Hints at Final Childish Gambino Album During Governor's Ball Set|website=Complex AU|access-date=July 15, 2017}}</ref> In September, he announced that he and Michelle were expecting a second son,<ref>{{cite web|author=Jen Juneau |url=http://people.com/babies/donald-glover-partner-michelle-pregnant-expecting-second-son/ |title=Donald Glover Announces Second Son on the Way at Emmys |publisher=People.com |date= |accessdate=September 18, 2017}}</ref> who was born in January 2018.<ref>Aiello, McKenna (January 5, 2018). [http://www.eonline.com/news/904066/donald-glover-welcomes-baby-no-2-with-girlfriend-michelle "Donald Glover Welcomes Baby No. 2 With Girlfriend Michelle."] ''EOnline.com''.
